items.headline: SGA Cleared for Thunder Return, Eyes MVP Repeat
items.summary: Reigning NBA Most Valuable Player Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has been cleared to return for the OKC Thunder after missing nine straight games with an abdominal strain. His return is a massive boost for the defending champions, who went 5-4 in his absence, as he continues to average 31.8 points, 6.4 assists, and 4.4 rebounds per game.

items.headline: Lakers Eyeing Pelicans' Trey Murphy III for 2026 Offseason
items.summary: The Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly targeting New Orleans Pelicans' forward Trey Murphy III as a key offseason acquisition in 2026, looking for a wing who can shoot and defend alongside Luka Doncic and LeBron James. The Golden State Warriors are also said to be interested in the $112 million talent.

items.headline: All-Star Deni Avdija Sidelined with Back Injury
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers' All-Star Deni Avdija, who has been stellar this season averaging 24.4 points, 7 rebounds, and 6.6 assists, is currently out with a back injury and missed last night's game against the Bulls. He had been struggling with the injury prior to the All-Star break.

items.headline: Suns Edge Lakers in Thriller
items.summary: Royce O'Neale hit a last-second three-pointer to lift the short-handed Suns over the Lakers. Grayson Allen led PHX with 28 points, while Luka Doncic exploded for 41 points, 8 rebounds, and 8 assists for LAL.

items.headline: Bey's Explosive 42 Leads Pelicans Past Jazz
items.summary: Saddiq Bey erupted for a career-high 42 points as the Pelicans defeated the short-handed Jazz. Zion Williamson added 20 points for NOP.

items.headline: Durant Drops 40 as Rockets Rally Past Magic
items.summary: Kevin Durant scored a season-high 40 points, including 26 in the second half, to lead the Rockets' comeback victory over the Magic. Reed Sheppard contributed 20 points off the bench.

items.headline: Trail Blazers Extend Bulls' Losing Streak to 11
items.summary: Jerami Grant scored 27 points to lead the Blazers past the Bulls, who suffered their 11th consecutive loss. Portland played without All-Star Deni Avdija.

items.headline: Spurs Dominate Nets for 11th Straight Win
items.summary: Julian Champagnie scored 26 points as the San Antonio Spurs extended their winning streak to 11 games with a dominant performance over the Brooklyn Nets. Rookie Stephon Castle added 18 points.

items.headline: Timberwolves Outlast Clippers in Low-Scoring Affair
items.summary: Anthony Edwards' 31 points powered the Timberwolves to a gritty victory over the Clippers.

items.headline: Kings Hand Mavericks Another Disheartening Loss
items.summary: Despite Naji Marshall's historic 36-point, 10-rebound, 6-assist performance, the Mavericks fell to the league-worst Kings, extending their home losing streak to six games.

Nets vs. Celtics
Knicks vs. Bucks
Grizzlies vs. Mavericks
Nuggets vs. Thunder
Luka Magic Continues
Bey Explodes for Career-High

items.statContext: vs. SAC - 3rd undrafted player to achieve this stat line since 1983-84.

items.headline: Ant-Man Leads Wolves
Rookie Castle Shines for Spurs
Spurs Extend Dominant Winning Streak to 11 Games
items.summary: The San Antonio Spurs continued their incredible run, winning their 11th consecutive game last night against the Nets. They now stand at 43-16, just two games behind the Western Conference-leading OKC Thunder.

items.headline: Mavericks' Trade Deadline Moves Under Scrutiny
items.summary: Dallas' recent trade deadline activities, including shipping Anthony Davis to the Washington Wizards, are being analyzed, with some suggesting the move was an admission of a past mistake. The team also acquired Tyus Jones.

items.headline: Key Injury Updates Across the NBA
items.summary: Beyond Deni Avdija (back), other notable injuries include Norman Powell (MIA) who exited last night's game with a groin strain, Lauri Markkanen (UTA) sidelined with a sprained ankle and hip impingement, and Phoenix's Devin Booker (hip strain) and Dillon Brooks (fractured hand) remain out.

items.headline: Bulls' Woes Continue with 11th Straight Loss
items.summary: The Chicago Bulls' struggles deepened as they suffered their 11th consecutive defeat last night against the Portland Trail Blazers, matching the third-longest losing streak in franchise history.
